thread.title: Baby girl born with fully-formed third leg sticking out of her groin due to rare parasitic twin
thread.title_full: Baby girl born with fully-formed third leg sticking out of her groin due to rare parasitic twin

author: mirror
title: Baby girl born with fully-formed third leg sticking out of her groin due to rare parasitic twin
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A baby girl born with a third leg that protruded from her groin area has had the extra limb successfully removed during a complex surgery. 
The seven-day-old girl, who hasn't been given a name yet, had a fully-formed third leg between her "normal" limbs but was otherwise completely healthy when she was delivered last week. 
The deformity was due to a parasitic twin - a rare occurrence seen in one in 100,000 births. 
Doctors said the baby will make a full recovery following Sunday's three-hour operation, as her relieved mother hailed the "God-sent" surgeons. Surgeons say the deformity was due to a parasitic twin (Photo: Newslions/SWNS) The baby girl underwent a three-hour operation to remove the extra limb (Photo: Newslions/SWNS) 
Srilatha Kanchanapally, 25, found out about her child's deformity during a routine scan in December. Read More Miracle baby boy given just 2.5% chance of survival defies the odds to make it to five months 
After the operation she said: "I am glad that we have been blessed with such a beautiful baby. 
"I was very confident that the doctors would be able to find a way to operate on the unwanted limb. The girl's parents hailed the doctors after the successful surgery (Photo: Newslions/SWNS) 
"They didn't disappoint us. They are God-sent to us." 
Her husband, Sambaih, added: "We are thankful to the doctors who operated on our baby. 
"The feeling that she would grow up as a normal child fills my heart with joy. 
"We were happy to have been blessed by a baby girl, but her deformity was a cause of worry for us. (Photo: Newslions/SWNS) 
He added: "Doctors have removed the extra limb with ease." Read More There's one amazing thing you can do with your umbilical cord after birth 
Ms Kanchanapally birth at Jangaon district hospital in India on March 21, and two days later the family were moved to Niloufer hospital in Hyderabad for the operation. 
Dr K Srinivas, who helped with the complex delivery, said before the surgery: "The extra limb was protruding from the child's pelvis area and can be surgically removed. The third leg was removed "with ease" (Photo: Newslions/SWNS) 
"Other than the extra limb, the baby was born with healthy vitals and she is in good health." 
Dr Ramesh Reddy, head of department of pediatric surgery at Niloufer Hospital, added: "It's a rare occurrence, seen one in 100,000 births. 
"It is a case of parasitic twin wherein technically a conjoint twin with regress having only rudimentary structures like a limb gets attached to the body of a well formed twin." Like us on Facebook
